intro: Curculigo latifolia var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy broad-leaved arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids, and is characterized by its arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its hairy texture on the leaves is a distinguishing feature of this variety.
